subject: Re: A convention to be kept?
msgSnippet: ... out ... Using apostrophes to mark PLURALS isn t supposed to be done in /any/ English writing! It s grammatically improper (see Greengrocers apostrophes
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "tim_rice09" <tim_rice09@...>
wrote:
>
>
> The apostrophy works well in T.O. to show the difference between
> plural, possesive and plural possesive case. It was recently pointed
out
> to me that even in phonetic writing it would still be usefull. In the
> Quickscript manual it is used in abbreviations like he'd and he'll
> though I am yet to find a place where it marks plurals.

Using apostrophes to mark PLURALS isn't supposed to be done in /any/
English writing! It's grammatically improper (see "Greengrocers'
apostrophes" in your search engine).
